ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000HOkJK:ref

Hi Botond,

What is required for the firewall rule to allow the off-network machines to update policy? Do you have documentation on this process that you could share with me please?

Thanks,
Matt

Subject: Agent update over internet [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0HOkJK:ref ]

Hi Matt, Thanks for reaching out! If your EPP server is online, the agents will communicate with it. If you have a rule in the firewall to only accept connections from the network in the U. S. , they won’t communicate, and a VPN is needed

Hi Matt,

Thanks for reaching out!
If your EPP server is online, the agents will communicate with it.
If you have a rule in the firewall to only accept connections from the network in the U.S., they won’t communicate, and a VPN is needed to connect to the U.S. network in order to update the policies.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption

TextBody:
Hi Matt,

I double checked, and the only way for those agents in Hong Kong to communicate with the server is for the server to be connected to the internet and to have an associated FQDN. The EPP clients need to be installed with that FQDN as the server address.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Hi Matt,

Thanks for reaching out!
If your EPP server is online, the agents will communicate with it.
If you have a rule in the firewall to only accept connections from the network in the U.S., they won’t communicate, and a VPN is needed to connect to the U.S. network in order to update the policies.

Best regards,
